revised_title: The Elusive Nature of the Yellow Pigment in Urine
tldr: The author investigates the yellow coloration in urine and concludes that it is not primarily due to urobilin, as previously thought. They suggest the presence of another, more abundant yellow pigment, which has yet to be isolated and fully understood. The author also discusses the limitations of previous methods for isolating the pigment and proposes a new approach to study it.
